intro: Pycnophyllum argentinum, commonly known as the Argentine thornapple, is a shrub native to South America. It belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its spiny stems and showy flowers. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or purple in color. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain numerous seeds. Pycnophyllum argentinum is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in dry grasslands and shrublands.
